description:
A ruthless arms dealer on a quixotic quest for world peace. A child soldier born into chaotic conflict. Their lives will intertwine as they journey together through the seedy underbelly of the world's arms market.

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

node.description:
Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Attended prestigious Tama Art University (Graphic Design faculty), but eventually dropped out. His debut work, Ordinary±, was a quasi-winner of Afternoon's Four Seasons Award in 1999. He also did illustrations for Tonari No Dopperu-san novel series and character design for Assassin in Fate/Grand Order.

[Website](http://tthtk.blog39.fc2.com) || [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KeitarouT)

[Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.

[Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.

**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__[Website](http://yanaginagi.net/) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi_info)__

__Introduction:__
yanaginagi, alternatively known as Gazelle, or otherwise simply known as nagi, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label NBC Universal. She is known for performing as a guest singer for the band [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell) under the name nagi from 2009-2011.

__Biography:__
During her childhood, she first became interested in music with the help of an electronic organ her mother received from the neighboring residents. She would go on to start composing music during Junior High School using DTM (Desktop Music) software her brother had bought.

In 2006, as a 19 year old, she would start making her indie debut by posting songs to the music site Player's Kingdom, where she would go on to produce many original songs. She has also posted songs to the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga under the name Gazelle, and participated as one of the singers in "Lantis Suite feat. Nico Nico Artists". During her stay at Nico Nico Douga, she would at one point come in contact with [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo), the leader of supercell, which eventually led her to start working with him. A couple of years later in March 2008, she would retire from music activites on the site Nico Nico Douga.

On February 29, 2012, she would make her major debut by releasing the single "[Vidro Moyou](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_iMfWt1hA8)" through Geneon Universal.

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/WFOXVIPER)

Affiliated with [White Fox](https://anilist.co/studio/314/) since its founding in 2007.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩佐岳)

Founder and representative director of [White Fox](https://anilist.co/studio/314/).

After dropping out of university he entered Yoyogi Animation Gakuin. During his time at the school he joined the animation studio [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/), and worked as a production assistant on [Mojakou](https://anilist.co/anime/2736/). Quickly thereafter he rose in rank and established his own animation team, Team Iwasa. Their first work was [Kasumin](https://anilist.co/anime/20858/). His policy for making anime was to make a polite work which is highly regarded by fans.

In 2007, Team Iwasa split from OLM and established itself independently as White Fox.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)

Website Satou Tenshou is a Japanese animator, formerly belonging to Studio Wanpack, now a member of White Fox. His favourite anime are Sennen Joyuu, Kidou Senshi Gundam: Gyakushuu no Char, and Onegai Teacher. His nickname is MacGuyver. Having only served as an animator since Gad Guard he has shown to be proficient at displaying flowing stuff and its linework as well as excelling at storyboarding and portraying a good sense of camera action.
